casebody.data:
CARILLON
v.
NCDHHS, et al. No. 54A06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 22, 2006. Melissa L. Trippe, Mark A. Davis, Special Deputy Attorney Generals, Thomas M. Woodward, Susan K. Hackney, Assistant Attorney Generals, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Solicitor General, for NCDHHS et al. Jim W. Phillips, Jr., Forrest W. Campbell, Jr., Greensboro, Charles F. Marshall, III, for Carillon Assistant Living. Susan M. Fradenburg, Allyson Jones Labban, Greensboro, for Ridge Care, Inc.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 20th day of November 2006 by MedCath Diagnostics, LLC for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 22nd day of November 2006."
